node.title: While Australia throws open its international borders, WA residents watch from the sidelines
node.alt: A close-up shot of a man from the waist down walking outside a hotel pulling two large white suitcases on wheels.
node.description: As international flights resume in other parts of the nation, West Australians are having to be patient, but the rumblings of discontent with the state's hard border stance are growing, writes Andrea Mayes.
node.content:
["After more than 20 long months of Australians being locked inside their own country, the nation has finally opened up for international travel.", "The first flight into Australia since the official ban on travel was lifted touched down in Sydney on Monday morning, allowing fully vaccinated Aussies to enter the country without needing to quarantine and giving rise to emotional scenes at Sydney Airport.", "Those who want to leave Australia can now do so without getting a special exemption from the government.", "\"It's time to give Australians their lives back,\" Prime Minister Scott Morrison said as he announced the opening of the international border last month.", "", "
Family reunions remain off the agenda for WA residents.(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "In New South Wales, Victoria or the ACT citizens can begin to plan longed-for family reunions and holidays abroad without facing a mandatory and expensive 14-days in hotel quarantine on their return.", "Similarly, in Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania or the Northern Territory\u00a0governments are planning to scrap hotel quarantine requirements over the coming weeks as vaccination rates lift.", "But there are no detailed plans if\u00a0you happen to live in Western Australia.", "
No timeline for WA border lifting
", "The WA government has repeatedly refused to say exactly when it will allow quarantine-free international travel, and there are signs that travel to and from the state is set to become even more restrictive, not less.", "Beyond vague assurances that the issue will be considered once the state reaches a double dose vaccination rate of between 80 and 90 per cent, Premier Mark McGowan has declined to set out a precise plan of how the state will reopen, much to the chagrin of the Opposition and the business lobby.", "", "
Mark McGowan says WA may open to international travel months later than other states.(AAP: Richard Wainwright)
", "\"Western Australia will open up internationally at some point in time \u2014 it's probably just a difference of months between us and other states,\" he said last month.", "\"If that means in the interim, we don't have mass deaths, we don't have huge dislocation in our economy, we don't have lots of people losing their jobs - well then I think the choice is clear.", "\"We wait until its safe.\"\u00a0", "There are no plans to ease the requirement for hotel quarantine or allow home quarantine.", "
New South Wales remains extreme risk
", "More than that, Mr McGowan has been reluctant to downgrade New South Wales from \"extreme risk\" to high risk\", despite the state's COVID rates tailing off dramatically in recent weeks.", "From a high of 1,599\u00a0COVID cases daily on September 10, NSW is now averaging about 217 cases a day \u2014 well below the 500 cases a day average WA requires for a state to be designated extreme risk.", "It's not the daily case rate that's now troubling the Premier, it's the risk he perceives to WA from the opening of borders in other states.", "He said last week the border with NSW and Victoria would not come down until \"sometime in the first half of next year\".", "Furthermore, parts of Australia WA currently allows people to travel to and from \u2014 South Australia, Queensland, Tasmania and the NT \u2014 may become off limits before Christmas, the Premier says, if community transmission of COVID begins to rise as a result of their borders opening.", "", "
WA is currently open to travellers from some states and territories, but that could tighten by Christmas.(ABC News: Jarrod Lucas)
", "The news is not going down well with some in WA, which has enjoyed a relatively COVID-free existence since the start of the pandemic, with minimal community transmission and only fleeting lockdowns.", "More than 35 per cent of the state's population was born overseas, and many more were born interstate.", "That's an awful lot of people with family and friends in other parts of the world and the country.", "And while West Australians have been extremely grateful to have escaped the terrible toll COVID has wreaked on other parts of the country, there are signs they may not be so willing to accept being cut off from the rest of the world for much longer.\u00a0", "", "
WA still has not set a date for reopening its borders to travellers.(ABC News: Tabarak Al Jrood)
", "\"Watching the East Coast reunite with their family and friends is so raw and emotional yet I can't help but feel for everyone, including myself and my family, who cannot embrace our loved ones because of Mark McGowan,\" one Facebook user wrote on ABC Perth's page yesterday.", "\"Your halo is slipping McGowan and you're running out of excuses.\"", "There were many others in a similar vein, as well as those supporting the Premier's stance.", "Still, it's a noticeable change in tone from the start of year, when the wildly popular Premier was enjoying stratospheric approval ratings and won the March state election with an unprecedented majority for Labor on the back of WA's success in keeping COVID out.", "", "
Mark McGowan remains popular, but some are questioning whether his hard border stance should be continued.(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "There's no doubt Mr McGowan retains the confidence of large swathes of the WA population.", "In any case, it would be nigh on impossible for any leader to retain in the longer term the sort of messianic popularity he has enjoyed, so some measure of decline in his fan base is inevitable.", "But it remains to be seen how long West Australians will have to put up with staring wistfully at their fellow Australians as they jump on planes to exotic destinations or enjoy tearful airport reunions with long-missed family members.", "And how long they will willingly accept doing so."]
